content.description:
Awkward jamming up a short and uninspiring fingers-to-hands crack. 

Furthest crack to the right of the crag, just right of Wankulator.
Single rack from 0.4 to #2 C4s, nuts. NO ANCHOR - you can use the Wankulator anchor but it can leave your second with a weird fall if you're not careful. Alternatively there is a thin tree further back, but too thin for my tastes.

Climb the series of cracks up to a tree anchor (no fixed anchor). 
  
 Walk off climbers left.

Follow standard approach to Pink Cliff, head up to left slabs and locate cracks on rightmost edge.
Standard rack.

The name of the route is somewhat of a misnomer, as there are no fist jams to be had.  This route climbs a short, steep, and slightly leaning flared crack using off fingers and thin hand jams.  If you have ever climbed at Vedauwoo, this will remind you of one of those 'harder than they look' routes that are oh so similar.  The right foot can be problematic most of the way.

Overall, this is a very good route that could use a bit more traffic to clean off some of the moss.  One knock against this route is that the route could use a convenient anchor. I was kind of surprised by this as the other routes at this crag have handy anchors.


the pink cliff is somewhat divided in half, with a slabby section on the left and a couple steep dihedrals on the right.  this route is on the right half of the crag and climbs the left of two prominent right facing dihedrals.  it is a striking line - you can't miss it.
off fingers to thin hands cams - 0.5 camalot to #1 camalot, maybe a #2 camalot for the top.

Climb the thin seam left of Environmentally Friendly. Move left and and follow bolts up bulges.

5 bolts, SR. Anchor with rappel ring on top

Furthest left side of Pink Cliff. Locate the large flake about 1-2m above the ground. Head up the left side into the right facing corner. 
 May be a bit dirty. 
  
 Walk off climbers left or rap from anchor chains.

Far left side of Pink Cliff, follow approach for Pink Cliff then head up to the left slabs.
Standard rack.

Climb the right side of the large flake next to People of Size. Continue up the slab past 3 bolts.

3 bolts, SR. Chains and rappel ring on top

Small cliff with a few fun climbs, not a busy spot. Good afternoon sun and a nice view of the Northridge development from the top.  
 Most routes have bolted/chain anchors, some shared.  Easy walk off around climbers left.
